thread.title: Johor businessman helps people cope with rising cost of living

author: thestar.com.my
title: Johor businessman helps people cope with rising cost of living
text:
JOHOR BARU: A businessman has come up with a way to cope with the high cost of living by offering three packets of nasi campur and three bottles of mineral water for only RM10.
Mohamad Faidzal Zainal introduced the Nasi Muafakat Bangsa Johor at his restaurant Ejohng Concept at Taman Sri Pulai Perdana last December. Each packet includes either chicken, beef or catfish and vegetables and is sold daily from 11am to 4pm, he said.
“We sell about 800 packets of rice daily and you can either take it away or dine in at the restaurant.
“From 4pm to 11pm, we serve ala carte Western and local cuisine,” said Faidzal in an interview.
He added the chicken and beef dishes would be cooked in different styles daily, either masak merah, masak kicap , curry or black pepper while the catfish tastes best when cooked with chilli or sambal. 
The food is prepared at the restaurant’s main kitchen in Taman Impian Emas here.
Apart from selling the rice at his own restaurant, Faidzal also assists others who want to earn extra income by allowing them to sell the rice at their own outlets.
A housewife sells about 200 packets of the rice daily by the roadside in Taman Emas Merah 2 in Pontian, he revealed.
She plans to open an outlet soon in Larkin Perdana, offering between 1,000 and 2,000 packets daily, said Faidzal who also owns a food-based manufacturing plant.
“This is our way of giving back to society and we are more than happy to make a minimal profit,” he added.
Faidzal plans to open a central kitchen in Puchong, Selangor which will be able to make 6,000 packets of rice daily for three outlets in Bangi, Putrajaya and Shah Alam.
Faidzal also distributes free meals to between 150 and 200 homeless people around Komtar JBCC and JB Night Bazaar every Friday and Saturday from midnight to 4am.
First-time customer Ang Chee Boon from Batu Pahat who came with his wife said a friend recommended he try out the food.
“Where can you get three packets of rice for RM10 plus free drinks nowadays?” he asked.
Muhammad Redha Redwan from Kampung Melayu said he would definitely return as the rice was not only affordable but tasty.
